result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam S. Radek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: NO possession of any dangerous weapons.

Absolute sobriety. 

NO contact wtih victim, T.Q.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. 

AODA and any follow up recommended. 

DNA sample (if not already taken).

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF782, 15CF1052 and 16CF995 called: 11:40am
State appears by ADA K.Puig and DA T.Wetzsteon.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Attys Lennon and Abernethy-Mays.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - Victim impact statement filed.

Argument by Atty Lennon regarding victim impact statement being received by COURT.

State moves to:
16CF995 - Ct. 1 (Battery by Prisoners/Repeater)>>AMEND to Misd Battery/Repeater with subsection of (1)(a).
16CF995 - Ct. 2 (Substantial Battery/Repeater)>>D&RI
15CF782>>D&RI entire file
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA:
16CF995 - Ct. 1 (Misd Battery/Repeater)>> GUILTY
15CF1052 - Ct. 1 (Felon Possess Firearm/Repeater)>> GUILTY 
15CF1052 - Ct. 2 (Poss w/Intent Heroin/ 2nd +Offense/Repeater)>> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

Officer Shawn Fristch (WPD) makes victim impact statement.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: 
16CF995 - Ct. 1 (Misd Battery/Repeater)>> 2 years TOTAL: 1  year incarceration and 1 year ES, concurrent to any other sentences
15CF1052 - Cts. 1 and 2>> 14 years TOTAL: 9 years incarceration and 5 years ES, on EACH COUNT, concurrent to each other and to any other sentences.
CONDITIONS OF ES>> Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; AODA and any follow up recommended; No possession of any dangerous weapons; Absolute sobriety; No contact with victim T.Q.; Restitution of $156 to T.Q. (Deemed to be paid in full); DNA sample (if not already taken) and surcharge; CC including $200 buy money to be repaid to Wausau Police Dept.
>>CREDIT in all counts of 1049 days.
Defendant IS eligible for both SAP and CIP.

Defendant remanded to WI State Prison system.

State appears by ADA K.Puig and DA Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty Julianne Lennon.

COURT denies Motion for Interlocutory appeal.
Atty Lennon states she will file Motion for Stay of Proceedings in appealate court tomorrow.

COURT addresses Motion to Dismiss regarding untimely speedy trial (filed by Atty Lennon) - Argument by State.
COURT makes findings and denies Motion to Dismiss.

State requests to address the motions filed by Atty Lennon - COURT grants motion regarding openings/closings.
COURT directs that the stun belt be employed by the jail as long as the clothing he is wearing is loose; No handcuffs to be employed if the stun belt is utilized.

Cases 15CF782, 15CF1052, and 16CF995 called: 9:08am
State appears by DA T.Wetzsteon, ADA K.Puig; Defendant appears in person/in custody with Atty Lennon in 15CFcases and Atty Abernethy Mays on 16CF995 case only.
(Motions Hearing)

State notes request of Defense to address Motion to Dismiss w/out Prejudice/Loss of Jurisdiction by COURT, and Committment for Plan first.
Atty Lennon moves COURT and cites case regarding unshackling and unhandcuffing defendant for this hearing -- COURT notes nothing received and that motion will not be heard today.
COURT addresses Motion to Dismiss/Lack of Competency by Court -- Argument by State (ADA Puig) on Motion; Argument by Attorney Lennon; Additional argument by ADA Puig; COURT makes findings and rulings - COURT denies Motion to Dismiss due to Lack of Competency by Court and Motion to refer to Committment thereafter.
9:50am - COURT recesses; COURT reconvenes at 10:02am - COURT notes all appearances the same except for Atty Abernethy Mays has been excused and 16CF995 is now adjourned.

State requests to address motion to suppress statements/medical records consent to release; Discussion/argument by Atty Lennon.
Agent Tami Sleeman [previously known as Augsburger] (DCI) sworn and testifies - identifies defendant.
COURT notes defense can make copy of transcript of recording and file to argue points in the motion.
State requests COURT take judicial notice of 12CF926 and 11CF1280 - argument by Atty Lennon; State to file actual paperwork they want COURT to review.
COURT questions Atty. Lennon regarding further witnesses.  Discussion/argument by Atty. Lennon and DA Wetzsteon.  Atty. Lennon to highlight points in the transcript that she considers to be in error and relay to COURT.
OTR 11:47 a.m.; BOTR: 1:03pm - Appearances remain the same.
State has provided copies of what are now marked as Exhibits 7 and 8 that attach Miranda forms in cases 12CF926 and 11CF1280 - Argument by Attorney Lennon on admission of Exhibits 7 and 8 and argument by State - COURT reserves ruling on those exhibits at this time.
State requests paring down the law enforcement witnesses in the hall - argument by Atty Lennon (COURT does not make any rulings).
Dr. James O'Donnell sworn and testifies by phone.
Lt. Bill Kolb (WPD) sworn and testifies.
S. B. sworn and testifies by phone.
O. A. sworn and testifies by phone.
Corissa Wobler (WI State Crime lab) sworn and testifies.
Argument by both counsel on Motion regarding Standing; COURT makes findings; COURT denies Motion - Defendant lacks standing to assert 4th amendment right to property.
COURT notes Motions 3 and 4 have not yet been addressed and will take those under advisement.
Atty Lennon requests Modification of Bond as filed 6/4/18 and argument by Attorney Lennon; COURT does not find any change in circumstance and DENIES request at this time.
State addresses requests by defense on FB and internal investigation police reports, and gives information to Atty Lennon.
Additional argument by Atty Lennon on Motion regarding seizure of defendant's person - COURT questions Atty Lennon.

COURT will advise parties of when decisions will be ready before trial

No contact with co-defendant(s): S.F. & S.T. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances.
